title: How to Remove a Connection From Your Facebook Account

steps.title: Open the Facebook app.
steps.content: Open the Facebook app. This looks like an f with a blue background. If you aren't already logged into your account, enter your email address or phone number and password to do so now.

steps.title: Tap ☰.
steps.content: Tap ☰ . On iPhone and iPad, this is at the bottom-right corner. On Android, this is at the top-right corner.

steps.title: Tap Settings & privacy.
steps.content: Tap Settings & privacy . You can find this below the app icons.

steps.title: Tap Settings.
steps.content: Tap Settings . A new page will open.

steps.title: Tap Apps and websites.
steps.content: Tap Apps and websites . This is below the Your activity header.

steps.title: Tap the connection you want to remove.
steps.content: Tap the connection you want to remove. This will be an app, game, or website.

steps.title: Tap Remove.
steps.content: Tap Remove . This is below the connection's name.

steps.title: Tap Remove again.
steps.content: Tap Remove again. This will confirm the action.

steps.title: Remove accounts from Accounts Center (optional).
steps.content: Remove accounts from Accounts Center (optional). If you're trying to remove a linked account from Facebook (such as Instagram or Meta), you can do so in the Accounts Center. Do the following: Navigate to Settings & privacy . Tap Settings . Tap Accounts Center . Tap Accounts . Tap Remove .

steps.title: Go to https://www.facebook.com/ in a web browser.
steps.content: Go to https://www.facebook.com/ in a web browser. You can use any browser. If you aren't already logged in, enter your email address or phone number and password to do so now.

steps.title: Click your profile icon.
steps.content: Click your profile icon. This is in the top-right corner. A drop-down menu will open.

steps.title: Click Settings & privacy.
steps.content: Click Settings & privacy . This is the first option underneath your name.

steps.title: Click Settings.
steps.content: Click Settings . A new page will open.

steps.title: Click Apps and websites.
steps.content: Click Apps and websites . You can find this in the left panel, underneath the Your activity header. You'll see a list of all connected apps or games.

steps.title: Click Remove next to the connection.
steps.content: Click Remove next to the connection. If you don't see any apps or games, you don't have anything linked to your Facebook account.

steps.title: Click Remove.
steps.content: Click Remove . This will confirm the action. The app or site may still have old information stored about you that you previously shared. You will need to contact the company or developer in charge of that app or site to try to remove that old information. When you delete a connection with a site, you may find that your ability to interact with that site is limited until you reactivate the connection.

steps.title: Remove accounts from Accounts Center (optional).
steps.content: Remove accounts from Accounts Center (optional). If you're trying to remove a linked account from Facebook (such as Instagram or Meta), you can do so in the Accounts Center.
